intro: Hieracium pseudopolycomum, commonly known as the false sandweed, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to Europe and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and sandy soils. It has small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Hieracium pseudopolycomum is known for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions and is often found in disturbed areas.
